page.title: 08Historical Events
page.content: There have not been too many historical events in Goring but here are a few.On Sheepcote field there are iron aged rings marked were the huts used to be. In Goring Roman coins were found and they had a river crossing here as well. In the Domesday Book Goring was written down as Garinges.The Pharish church is the oldest building in Goring.In 1647 the ferry sank and everyone on it was drowned.Quite a few people have lived in Goring including Sir Arthur Harris or Bomber Harris.In the 20th centruary the Thames iced over and people skated on it.The Pharish church was built by Robert D'Oyley.A few mouths ago the station was burnt down.The railway roof and waiting room was totally burnt down.
